alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 1:29PM MST until January 22 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST MONDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches above 6500 feet, 4 to 8 inches above 7500 feet, and 8 to 12 inches above 8000 feet. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet across northern Arizona. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially all day Sunday and for the Monday morning commute. The majority of the hazardous travel will take place on portions of I-17 from Munds Park to Flagstaff, I-40 from Williams to Flagstaff, and Buffalo Pass in the Chuska Mountains. Snow forecast from 11 PM Today to 8 AM Monday: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Buffalo Pass 4 to 8 inches Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Flagstaff 2 to 4 inches Forest Lakes 5 to 9 inches Fredonia 0 inches Ganado 0 to 1 inches Grand Canyon 0 to 1 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Jacob Lake 3 to 5 inches Kachina Village 3 to 5 inches Munds Park 3 to 5 inches North Rim 8 to 12 inches Pinetop-Lkside 2 to 4 inches Shonto 0 to 1 inches Show Low 0 to 1 inches Valle 0 inches Whiteriver 0 inches Williams 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 0 to 1 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
